reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports every 6 months, with a midterm report no later than 28 February 2013 and a final report no later than 15 August 2013
summary:
17. Underscores the importance of regularly updating the military concept of operations and rules of engagement, and requests the Secretary-General to report on them to the Security Council and troop-contributing countries.

18. Encourages the Government of Liberia to develop national security and rule of law institutions, and encourages coordinated progress on the implementation of the Security and Justice Development Plans and the National Human Rights Action Plan.

19. Encourages ECOWAS and the Mano River Union to develop a subregional strategy to address cross-border movements of armed groups and weapons, with the assistance of UNOCI and UNMIL.

20. Requests the Secretary-General to provide regular updates on the situation on the ground, progress towards achieving transitional benchmarks, and development of a transition plan, and to provide a midterm report by 28 February 2013 and a final report by 15 August 2013.

21. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
